bar. Held the third Wednesday of every month.

description:
Site Visit - Studio of Pacific Architecture - Te Aro Double-Header!, Join us on Wednesday 20 August, for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site tour of two very different but geographically close projects in Te Aro. The National War Memorial and FPC Martin Square are both undergoing major refurbishment - join us for a look behind the scenes!
National War Memorial: Refurbishing a Wellington Icon
Step behind the scaffolding and witness the National War Memorial Project – a complex seismic strengthening project where heritage sensitivity is of utmost importance. With construction works being carried out by Maycroft Construction, join us for the rare opportunity to explore a significant piece of the capital’s cultural fabric.
Known to many as the backdrop of ANZAC Day commemorations, this national memorial is undergoing a meticulous refurbishment to ensure its legacy endures for generations to come.
 What’s Happening On Site:
Seismic strengthening of the tower and bell frame 
Stone remediation to preserve its historic façade
Asphalt roofing works
The real challenge? Balancing modern engineering with heritage preservation. Every upgrade is being carried out with deep respect for the building’s historical significance.

Then, just around the corner, we will move on to another refurbishment project – at a much different scale and for a very different purpose!
 FPC Martin Square: from Workshop to Office Space
Leading industrial design-and-build specialists First Principles Constructors are celebrating seven years of innovation with a bold move - into a brand-new headquarters in central Wellington. Take a look inside the transformation of a former engineering workshop into the new HQ for FPC. With exposed services, raw materials, and an industrial aesthetic, this compact yet clever refurbishment shows how much can be achieved in a small urban footprint. Construction is well underway by Aoraki Construction, with completion coming up in September.
What’s Happening On Site:
•     Structural steel installation, new roofing, cladding, a new concrete mezzanine slab
•     Interior fit-out works
•     Full building services upgrades
 The Details:
🕒 DATE and TIME: Wednesday, 20th August, meet at 2.45pm for a 3.00pm start at the National War Memorial
📍 LOCATION: Meet at the National War Memorial (19 Buckle Street) to explore this site first. We will then walk over to 21 Martin Square as a group, for the next site visit.
🎟️ COST: Free to NAWIC members, with a maximum of 18 people on the tour, so please book your space consciously. Get in quick! You can join NAWIC here.
👷‍♀️PPE: Hard hat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots. (Spare hard-hats/hi-vis are available if required, please make sure you advise us of what you need on your RSVP.)
 🎉 After the site visits, unwind with drinks and nibbles sponsored by First Principles Constructors at a nearby venue (TBC) – a chance to connect, reflect, and chat all things design and construction.
🧡 Huge thanks to Studio of Pacific Architecture, Aoraki Construction, Maycroft Construction, and First Principles Constructors for teaming up to make this event possible.
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.
label: Other

description: Wellington Lens Club Fortnightly Meetup, Calling on all photography enthusiasts! Join us this Friday for another fortnightly meetup with the Wellington Lens Club! We gather every second Friday at Heyday Beer Co (264a Cuba Street) 5:30-7pm - if we meet else where it will be announced on the event discussion and in the group. We'll kick off this weeks event with drinks and engaging conversations about camera lenses. Photo walk begins 7pm until 8:30pm, followed by a delicious dinner from 8:30-10pm. This FREE event is open to everyone, especially those interested in vintage lenses and adapting them to modern cameras. Don't miss out!

description:
Saturday 'BAKES' By Onslow College, Each Saturday, we offer a variety of sourdough products next to Onslow College. We always have doughnuts, but on Saturdays we offer bread, savoury baked items (this Saturday, we have brioche), and mini-celebratory sourdough doughnuts.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday morning through our website.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
EFTPOS is always available.
Our boxed mini-celebratory doughnuts, 70% of the original size, are available for a sale price of $25 for a box of all six flavours.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase all week. Contact Mark on 021 0223 0824 for next-day pickup.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
We launch a new flavour every two weeks and have created over 180 combinations since selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
If you are not following us on our social media channels, please consider doing so, as it helps the company grow and increases the exposure of our products. Thank you.

description:
Your City. Your Voice. – Ethnic Communities Forum 2025, Join us for Your City. Your Voice. – a community-led forum designed by and for Wellington’s ethnic communities.
Saturday 23 August
Wellington Indian Association, 48 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie.
2pm to 4pm
Doors open from 1.30pm
This special event brings people together to kōrero about the issues that matter most in our neighbourhoods — and how we can shape the future of our city, together.
What’s on?
Housing – Updates and support
City Safety – Learn about new initiatives and share your ideas for safer neighbourhoods
Small Business – Hear about tips, tools and opportunities
City Revitalisation – Updates on upcoming major city projects and what they mean for our communities
Family-friendly
Delicious kai provided to share and enjoy together.
All voices welcome
The capacity for this venue is 150 people, and the doors will close for entry once that capacity is reached.
Whether you’re new to Wellington or a long-time local, we’d love to see you there.
This is a free event - No need to register — just show up, bring your whānau, and take part.
Be heard. Be seen. Help shape Pōneke
Contact: Engagement@wcc.govt.nz for any questions

Step into the spotlight and share your talent on the Upstairs stage.
Music, stand-up, poetry, storytelling, movement, experiments. If it's performable, it's welcome.
No genre too strange, no format too small.

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Other

description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Jason Gurney, Lecture title " Our promise to each other". In this deeply personal lecture, Jason will guide us through his dual Pākehā and Māori upbringing, and the experiences that drew him into a career in public health. While sharing lessons from his career so far, he will walk us through the choices we could make – and promises we could keep – to bridge the divide in health and life outcomes experienced by Māori.’

If you have any burning questions about registering your upcoming event for next year's festival, we would love to hear all about it and see how we can help!
We look forward to meeting you if it’s your first time at NZ Fringe or seeing you again and hearing about what you’ve been cooking up for 2026. Come and celebrate 36 years of innovation and creativity at the Birthplace of Brilliance, the New Zealand Fringe Festival!
We look forward to seeing you in person on the 26th of August, on the second level at the bar at Te Auaha from 6pm

description:
Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show, It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.
When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.
The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.
With support from Frances Grass.

description:
Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!, Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.
label: Other

description:
Toi Pōneke Market Lane Tours: CANCELLED, We’re excited to announce tours of the new Toi Pōneke whare at 3-6 Market Lane, Wellington. We will be occupying a portion of the building on the corner of Cable Street and Market Lane.

Before our new premises undergo a refit, we invite you to tour the interior of the building and see where the artist studios, arts offices and workshop space will be located.

Tours are available on Sat 30 Aug '25 at 11am, 12noon, 1pm and 2pm and Sun 31 Aug '25 at 10am, 11am, 12noon, and 1pm.

The re-imagined Toi Pōneke Moemoeā (Vision) is:
He kaiwhakatere i te tupu me te whanaketanga o ngā ringatoi o Te Whanganui-a-Tara

A catalyst for the growth and development of Wellington artists

Our new Toi Pōneke will create a vibrant space that nurtures collaboration, creativity and cultural exchange among artists of all generations using Tuakana-Teina Kaupapa. 

For more information head to the Toi Pōneke website.
label: Other

description:
Tough Guy Book Club - Lower Hutt NZ Chapter, Join us for the Lower Hutt NZ Chapter of Tough Guy Book Club.
You can find out this month's book here https://toughguybookclub.com/books
If you have the chance, try to pick up the book and read a couple of pages before the night. If you haven’t, come anyway, no one gives a damn. We are not your boss.
If you got one, make sure to bring your copy of the books down, it’ll help you talk about bits of it, we suggest underlining stuff that sticks out to you as important.
Also like all months, we will be announcing next month’s book at the meeting and handing them out to those of you who were wise enough to pre-order last month.
See you there.
Want to know more about Tough Guy Book Club? Read this -
http://toughguybookclub.com/about-us
label: Other

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.
label: Other

description:
Tangihanga, Created and performed by Kristyl Neho

Tangihanga is a solo drama-comedy centred around Jess - a devoted daughter whose father, Karanipa, has passed away. As Jess’ whānau gathers at the marae to mourn, tensions rise, secrets are revealed, and long-held family dynamics begin to unravel. Neho masterfully embodies over 30 characters, capturing the complexity of grief, cultural identity, and the strength of whānau. This bold, emotionally charged, and often hilarious performance speaks to the heart of Aotearoa.

“A graceful celebration of the power of theatre to create and tell a story.” - Tanya Piejus, Regional News

Audience care: Contains themes of grief and loss. Recommended for audiences aged 9+.
label: Other

description: 2025 World of Wearableart (wow) Show: Rise, Experience the extraordinary at the 2025 WOW Show: RISE, as a city comes alive in celebration of the creative spirit. Audience and show will together ignite the creative spirit that lives in all of us, as Aotearoa’s finest performers bring the world’s leading wearable art to life onstage. With WOW's internationally acclaimed creative team at the helm, don't miss this unforgettable spectacle of boundless imagination and jaw-dropping artistry.
label: Other

description:
Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

You can’t teach an old dog new tricks... can you? Biting satire and theatre wizardry fuse in a comically inventive roller-coaster about the fear of irrelevance and the healing power of an animal. Award-winning actor, writer, and solo performer, Stephen Papps, plays twelve characters with beguiling virtuosity, in this gloriously funny solo tour de force about a man who loses face in a desperate attempt to regain his relevance.

“It’s impressive for a performer to embody a big range of characters ... well-written and full of humorous insights and revelations ... glorious!” – Cate Prestige, Theatreview.

Audience care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+
label: Other

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages
label: Other

description:
Community Evening Trimester 2 2025, About Ignite:
Ignite Consultants is a student-run charitable organisation that provides free and creative advice to charities and social organisations across Aotearoa. All of our consultants are passionate and talented student-volunteers who are driven by their desire to foster social change. Our vision is to help organisations to maximise their impact through harnessing the fresh perspectives of university students. 
We run two project cycles per year which coincide with the university semesters, each lasting for a duration of 9 weeks. Each team consists of a local charity, 5-6 students, a project manager (a person who has been through the Ignite Consultants experience before) and a professional mentor who has experience in consulting and/or the industry the organisation works in. 
About the Event:
Ignite's Community Evening is a special occasion where our consultants share what they have learnt, created and experienced over the past nine weeks. This event is an opportunity to learn about the remarkable charities we have collaborated with this semester, to enjoy delicious food and to extend our heartfelt thanks to all our supporters. 
This semester, attendees will get to hear presentations from the teams who have worked with WELLfed, Take10, Orange Sky, PACE and The Charitable Recycling Trust. 
To join us virtually, please click on the link below:
label: Other

description:
Jonathan Crayford - Bikes in Space tickets, Presented by: Jonathan Crayford
Jonathan Crayford introduces his latest project 'Bikes In Space' an electronic vintage keys and drums driven fully improvised groove space junk ensemble that sounds like what it might be like to be in the brain of Philip K Dick, Ursula Le Guin or Margaret St Clair - except more. After a 2 month tour of Auckland, they hit Nui with added punch to the drums featuring Riki Pirihi and Julien Dyne.
Jonathan Crayford keys, Joe Kaptein keys, Riki Pirihi drums, Julien Dyne drums.
